East-West conflict

  • By Artem V. Shamsutdinov
  • February 10th, 2024

I was just recently listening to a lecture by Andrei Lan'kov who explained that the roots of eastern collectivism go to the construction and maintenance of rice fields, which are engineering projects that can't be managed by an individual family.  China is only now transitioning from an agrarian culture to an urban culture and up until relatively recent times single family farming was not an option - everything was done as a collective at village level.  From that stemmed the eastern concepts of collective work, high levels of discipline, extreme levels of conformism and high levels of mutual trust (within your group) and solidarity.  This applies to all Far East cultures and has spread to all levels of its society including business.  Only up until very recent (in historical times) times their economies had high levels of centralization.
